section.title: Introduction
section.p:
As of HP Helion OpenStack 2.0, you must follow these steps to perform backups:
Define what you want to backup.
Define a mode for that backup. The following modes are available:
fs (filesystem) (default)
mysql
sqlserver
mongo It is recommended that you use snapshots if the mode is mysql, sqlserver, or mongo.
Define whether to use a snapshot in the file system for the backup.
In Unix systems LVM is used (when available).
In Windows systems virtual shadow copies are used.
Define a storage media in a job from the following list:
swift (requires OpenStack credentials)(default)
local (no credentials required)
SSH (no credentials required) (not implemented on Windows)

body.section:
Basic Configuration
There are several mandatory arguments to execute a backup:
Action (backup by default)
Mode (fs by default)
Path-to-backup
Backup-name
Container (swift container or local path)
Storage (swift by default) For HP Helion OpenStack 2.0, you can create a backup using only mandatory values as in the following example: - freezerc --action backup --mode fs --storage swift --path-to-backup /home/user/tmp --container tmp_backups --backup-name backup1 The translation to a configuration file for this backup execution would be as follows:
{ "job_actions": [ { "freezer_action": { "action": "backup", "mode": "fs", "backup_name": "backup1", "path_to_backup": "/home/user/tmp", "container": "tmp_backups" }, "max_retries": 3, "max_retries_interval": 60 } ], "job_schedule": { "schedule_interval": "24 hours" }, "description": "backup for tmp dir" }
In this configuration file (JSON), the freezer command is wrapped in the "freezer_action" key. All "-" are translated to "_" and the first "--" are omitted. As of HP Helion OpenStack 2.0, we can define the schedule rules that this job will follow (only available through the configuration file) and a brief description of the job.

section.title: Restoring your Data
section.p:
As of HP Helion OpenStack 2.0, you must do the following in order to restore data after a backup:
Select a backup to restore.
Define a mode for the restore: The following modes are available:
fs (filesystem) (default)
mysql
sqlserver
mongo
If the restore involves an application (such as mysql) remember to shut down the application or service and start it again after the restore.

section.title: Basic Configuration
section.p: To restore from a backup, note that in some cases you must stop the service (for instance MySQL) before the restore.

There are several mandatory options to execute a restore:
action (backup by default)
mode (fs by default)
restore-abs-path
backup-name
container (swift container or local path)
storage (swift by default)
restore-from-host
restore-from-date (optional)

You can create a restore using mandatory values, as in the following example: - freezerc --action restore --mode fs --storage swift --restore-abs-path /home/user/tmp --container tmp_backups --backup-name backup1 --restore-from-host ubuntu

ol.li: Get the id corresponding to the job "HLM Default: Deployer restore";
Launch the restore: freezer-scheduler -c <deployer hostname (generaly hLinux)> job-start -j <job-id>
Wait for some time, you can follow the /var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log

On each compute node you want to restore, run the following steps:
Become root sudo su
Source backup environment file:source /etc/freezer/backup.osrc
List jobs:freezer-scheduler -c <hostname> job-list
Get the id corresponding to the job "HLM Default: Nova restore".
Launch the restore:freezer-scheduler -c <hostname> job-start -j <job-id>
Wait for some time, you can follow the /var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log
Once OK, restart Nova.
